ἐπιξεν-όομαι,
Epic dialect ἐπιξειν- [Refs]:—passive, to be entertained as a guest, dwell abroad, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]; to be on a visit, εἰς Ὀξύρυγχα Mitteis [Refs 3rd c.BC+]; ἐ. τινί to be entertained by one, A.R.[same place], [Refs 1st c.AD+]; Σοφοκλεῖ ζῶντι Ἀσκληπιὸν ἐ. [Refs 3rd c.AD+]
__2. have hospitable relations with, be intimate with, ἐπεξενῶσθαι πολλοῖς [Refs 4th c.BC+]; ἡ ἐπιξενωθεῖσα σώμασι μοῖρα lent to or communicated with, [Refs]
__II. as middle, in [Refs] I appeal to thee in these matters, as one at death's door,[Refs]
